page.title: 01RUYTON
page.content: {Ruyton of the Eleven Towns,}once a borough town, is now a parish and village of 1,000 inhabitants. In the middle of the 12th Century the 3 manors of Ruyton, Wykey and Felton were united to form 1 manor of Ruyton comprising 11 townships namely Coton, Eardiston, Haughton, Rednal, Shelvock, Shotatton, Sutton, Tedsmore, West Felton,Wykey and of course, Ruyton. All eleven still appear on ordnance survey maps but possibly now only as a farmhouse. To the East of the village flows the River Perry which marked the boundary between medieval Shropshire and the Marcher land of Wales. It is said that any Welshman found on the eastern side of the River Perry was slain on sight. All that is left of the castle is a fragment of, possibly, the base of the square tower.
